Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: Illustrate and identify two distinct habitats accurately, such as a forest and a pond.
Draw and label a variety of living things in each habitat, like trees, squirrels, and birds in the forest; fish, frogs, and water plants in the pond.
Compare and contrast living things in the two habitats through their drawings, noting differences in species but showing the environments as part of nature.
Demonstrate patterns of biodiversity by showing multiple species within each habitat, even if some details or species are missing.
Organize and present observations clearly with mostly correct labeling, reflecting an understanding of diversity in plant and animal life.
CANNOT: Consistently and fully represent the entire range of biodiversity in each habitat (may miss some species or show an incomplete community of organisms).
Precisely label or mention interactions between species and their roles in the ecosystem (student may overlook some interactions or roles).
